intro: Xylobium colleyi, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often on rocky soils. Xylobium colleyi has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
